biography.value:
Bheur hags live in wintry lands, favoring snowy mountains. These hags become more active during winter, using their ice and weather magic to make life miserable for nearby settlements.

A bheur hag’s skin has the bluish hue of a person who has frozen to death. The hag’s hair is white, and the hag is emaciated, with pale eyes surrounded by bruise-colored flesh. A bheur hag carries a twisted gray wooden staff that can be ridden like a flying broom and that augments the hag’s magic.

Bheur hags are attracted to selfish actions inspired by deadly cold, such as murdering a traveler for a winter coat or chopping down a dryad;dryad’s grove for firewood. These actions are especially sweet to a bheur if they are unwarranted, such as a greedy merchant hoarding excess food for the winter while others starve. Bheurs use their ability to manipulate weather to batter villages with freezing cold, hoping to instill a despair that turns folk against each other.

In combat, a bheur hag also strives to inspire horror. When near a recently slain foe, the hag may forgo an attack to feed on the corpse. The sight of this butchery is enough to terrify most witnesses.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The hag makes two Slam or Frost Shard attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 4d8 type=cold average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 6d8 + @mod type=cold average=true]] damage, and the target’s speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the hag’s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The hag feeds on the corpse of one enemy within reach that died within the past minute. Each creature of the hag’s choice that is within 60 feet and able to see the feeding must succeed on a [[/save wis 15 format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the hag for 1 minute. While &Reference[frightened]{frightened} in this way, a creature is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}, can’t understand what others say, can’t read, and speaks only in gibberish. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag’s Horrific Feast for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
While holding or riding the graystaff, the hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

At will: hold person

1/day each: &Reference[cone]{cone} of &Reference[cold]{cold}, ice storm, wall of ice

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Control Weather (1/Day). The hag can cast the control weather spell, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Graystaff Magic. The hag carries a graystaff, a magic staff. The hag can use its flying speed only while astride the staff. If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Ice Walk. The hag can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check, and difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost the hag extra moment.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Choose a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

A blast of &Reference[cold]{cold} air erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 60-foot &Reference[cone]{cone} must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. A creature takes 8d8 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

A hail of rock-hard ice pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} centered on a point within range. Each creature in the &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A creature takes 2d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage and 4d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Hailstones turn the storm's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

You create a wall of ice on a solid surface within range. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a &Reference[sphere]{sphere} with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for the duration.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature within its area is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has AC 12 and 30 hit points per 10-foot section, and it is vulnerable to &Reference[fire]{fire} damage. Reducing a 10-foot section of wall to 0 hit points destroys it and leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. A creature moving through the sheet of frigid air for the first time on a turn must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. That creature takes 5d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage the wall deals when it appears increases by 2d6, and the damage from passing through the sheet of frigid air increases by 1d6, for each slot level above 6th.

system.chatFlavor: [5d6 - cold] Damage from passing through the wall; Constitution saving throw for half damage
